website_summaries.verdict: Despite small annoyances, the Sony Alpha 6000 is a great overall camera for more advanced photographers who want something smaller than a dSLR, especially if they need the continuous- shooting speed.
pros: The Sony Alpha 6000 has seriously fast continuous shooting for the money, and its design improves upon its predecessor's already excellent one
Plus it's got an extensive feature set
cons: The movie record button remains annoying, and while it delivers excellent photo quality, it's not best-in-class in low light

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for everyday use and travel
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this camera. I only wish it had a GPS encoding feature. We got it for our trip to Australia and New Zealand and took thousands of pictures over the course of a month. I love the light weight and small size. I use a wrist strap instead of a neck strap and that is very handy. Battery life was fine, but I did buy some extra batteries and needed one when we were out all day. The features available are amazing, but it is still easy to use. I will be mastering it for months more to come. There are some great tutorials on the web and I'd encourage you to watch them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harmison

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this camera. The compact size is perfect for the mom on the go. It fits in my purse adn gives me images with excellent quality. I previously had a Nikon D5200 and I find that this Sony matches or exceeds it in every way. The kit lenses are surprisingly great quality and give me nice crisp clean photos. I'm now saving up for an A7R because I love this one so much and need the full frame version!
customer_reviews.author: Emily J- The Muchness Mama

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera, even for noobs like me!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. I'm an amateur photographer but this thing makes me feel like a pro! I can't wait to buy another lens! I highly recommend buying a Think Tank Mirrorless Mover camera bag so you can store everything in one place. Also necessary for those just starting out is a separate battery charger pack with two back-up batteries - worth it and it even comes with European adaptor -. I bought an excellent tripod here as well -. Thank-you so much Amazon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Monique F.

customer_reviews.title: Consistently Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Fastest focus in the West (or anywhere). The pictures are amazing. You can zoom in so far when shooting RAW (buy a large memory card though). I’m definitely no pro but this camera is so fun to use and isn’t that the point of a hobby? Once you start learning how to use the setting beyond auto, it keeps getting funner and funnerer. Seriously though, if you’re looking for an excellent mirrorless dslr, look no further. Even though this model is a few years old, it is still extremely powerful and will blow the doors off many new cameras in the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I am basically a novice in photography. I have not used any camera other than phone camera until now. This camera makes it incredibly easy for me to take good shots with its auto focus. I did not get a chance to go out and take landscape photos. For now I only take moon shots at night. I attached couple of them I took with 55-210 mm lens without tripod. I am pretty satisfied with the result. I certainly recommend it to the novices like me.
customer_reviews.author: Halit Dogan

customer_reviews.title: Simplistic & complex. $ 4 $ a winner.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this camera. For the dollars nothing comes close. Light weight, high frame rate(double compared to mirrored) extremely fast focusing, built in stabilizing that's unreal, German lens with Japanese brains!..... I could go on. Bought it for video shooting, but I'm re-interested in general photography again. Beautiful pictures is an understatement. If your on a budget, get the alpha with the single lens. I bought extra batteries and the dueling charging dock. Use San Disk Ultra Extreme SD cards too. Don't mess about. This camera is worthy.
customer_reviews.author: mtndabber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking to purchase this camera for a couple of years and took the plunge right before traveling overseas. I used auto for every thing and the photos came out really well. Does and excellent job in low light and bright day light. I even let my friend borrow it when she traveled to Europe a couple of months after I did. Small enough to travel well and light enough to not weigh you down when walking everywhere on tour all while taking fantastic photos.
customer_reviews.author: Scattered Creative

customer_reviews.title: My latest purchase was a D7200 which is a great camera but when you are traveling it can become ...
customer_reviews.text: Since 1978 I am Nikon fanatic. My latest purchase was a D7200 which is a great camera but when you are traveling it can become a heavy burden having to carry the camera plus additional lenses and accessories, so I decided to give it a try with the Sony Alpha a6000. I must say I am very pleased with the quality of the photographs,it is so light even with an additional 200mm zoom lens. As far as I am concerned I absolutely love this small camera, which is the one I now take when I travel both as a tourist and for business. It's by my side all the time. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camera is great. Seller is questionable.
customer_reviews.text: The a6000 is a great price and exactly what you should expect to get for this price. I'm seriously never going back to Nikon or Canon ever again Sony really knows how to make a high quality product for the price. Plus mirrorless is just the way to go hands down. My only complaint is that the seller did not send me the Charcoal body color which I requested, and the a6000 came in a6500 packaging for some reason??? Which was just a double let down.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first non point and shoot camera. I've had this camera for about 6 months now. I've been mostly using all the auto features. Auto intelligent setting mostly. Just recently, I bought a book called understanding exposure and I can't believe how much I was missing out on by just using the auto settings. This camera still takes great pictures in auto mode, but I want to know why it's taking great pictures and what settings do what.
customer_reviews.author: Jkoe

customer_reviews.title: Mobile app for wifi transfer is not working.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro photographer but i liked the photos from the canon eos m2 more than the a6000’s. I know is subjective but 3 of us in the family agreed that the eos m2 has better images. It might be due to the lens but I used both of the original lens they came with. The main advantage of the a6000 is its fast focusing speed where the eos m2 is lacking. There are other major differences but the main drawback for a6000 is that the mobile for transferring photos via wifi is not working and it is the deal breaker for this camera. Shame on sony.
customer_reviews.author: jam25

customer_reviews.title: The camera is working fine so far
customer_reviews.text: The camera is working fine so far. I was a little annoyed at the web site, since it did not actually list the contents of the package. For what it's worth, I got: A6000 body, body cap, battery, charge cable (USB-A to micro-USB), charger (1.5A), Sony neck strap, and manuals. In a Sony A6500 box - but I guess that's what they had handy. Since then, I've ordered an extra battery, a cover for the hot shoe, and a memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: So far is exactly what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sony RX 100 III that is a fantastic camera for vacations, etc. I wanted something to use more or less for selective photographs and the 6000 has done just that. I am by no means a pro but I enjoy taking my time in setting up and trying to get different shots. I am learning as I go. Very nice package to do just that. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade without going full frame.
customer_reviews.text: Beatiful camera that takes really good pictures but outstanding video also. Very versatile so much so that it will take me some time to expand my lense and accessoriey. Haven't yet learned to use all the features but also using it in one of the auto positions is a life saver. Eats up batteries fast so I bought 2 spares.
customer_reviews.author: Sergeant V.

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: Am an advanced amateur photographer and love this camera! From, the best thing is the mirrorless design which renders it nice and light, perfect for hikes and family get-togethers. The photos are sharp and clear and the various modes are easy to use and intuitive. It's a perfect camera for my skill level and well beyond!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: great camera, I dont care that it is not ...
customer_reviews.text: great camera, I dont care that it is not the latest and greatest, it works great, it goes full manual if I want control, and full auto if I am not in to mood to be a pro photographer. this replaced my DSLR which I did like, but I never took it with me because it was too big. After I bought it, I discovered this is actually quite a popular and capable camera. I can say it is the best camera I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Axxman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: The seller was great! I requested an earlier delivery date and they expedited it. I got the cam 2 days before my actual date. I really appreciated that. The picture quality is great. Camera is not bulky nor heavy, light enough to lug around all day. The zoom lens works well, pic isn’t noisy. One thing I didn’t like is that I bought a new camera, but it came with some scratches. Which means it probably wasn’t. All in all, very good investment
customer_reviews.author: Shelly-Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera for which many great Sony lenses work!
customer_reviews.text: a6000 is a great camera to shoot not only photos but videos too. The only downside is that it doesn't have an audio input for a microphone. However you have to spend double on the a6500 and higher one that does have it. For now I just record my audio separately to a cell phone with a lavalier mic and edit in Adobe Premier. Works just fine. See the video I've posted for the example of how well this camera works with a lens that I purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Great time for photography. So long 35mm.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Sony A6000 with the Sony Selp18105G E PZ 18-105mm F4 G OSS. The ability to instantly upload to the iphone and view them is one of my favorite features. I shoot with manual mode, in fine jpeg and do some simple photo editing in the iphone app. You can send them off to the photo lab of your choice. The average picture file size is 1616 x 1080. 350 x 350 DPI. So you can get a excellent 5” x 7” or a fairly good 8” x 10”. I order the 8” x 12” prints, and I still believe they have exceptable IQ.
customer_reviews.author: John Brockell

customer_reviews.title: Great value for dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. If your not a photographer but still want quality DLSR without the bulk. This is a fantastic camera. Night time pics are great, just make sure to use a tripod or have very steady hands. Next few years I'll spend the money to get a $1000+ Sony DLSR camera. I purchased this camera for business related use.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for a great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mirrorless camera, and my first Sony! I thought I’d give it a go since I heard such great reviews!! It is phenomenal, I really enjoy this camera! It is easy to use and the picture quality is excellent. If your looking for a really good camera for a good price, this is it! The only downside that it has is that it doesn’t take an external mic, which is fine by me, I don’t do video.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Guys I LOVE this camera and am SO SO SO happy with ...
customer_reviews.text: Guys I LOVE this camera and am SO SO SO happy with it. I'm a total photography noob and have no idea what I'm doing, so I did days of research to decide which camera I would purchase. I finally settled on this thing, and so far it ha been working pretty darn great! The only complaint I have is that I can't seem to figure out how to send the photos to my phone or laptop. I press the button and such and just can't seem to connect my computer or phone to the wifi. The photos are great quality, and are perfect for starting my new Etsy store and for sharing photos on Instagram.
customer_reviews.author: Lexie D.

customer_reviews.title: Sony customer service was really nice at problem solving with us and he determined that ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Sony Alpha a6000 Digital Camera new through Amazon. It was defective :(. Sony customer service was really nice at problem solving with us and he determined that there is a microchip malfunction. Very disappointing, but Amazon is shipping us a new item. I hope when it comes in that we will love it and can change the one star rating. Edit 5/23 We now received the new camera and woila...it works perfects and is amazing. Very much like our old one, but with many new features. Will now put this camera where it belongs at 5 stars and Sony and Amazon should also get 5 stars for helping with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: ... a professional photographer but this camera takes some very good pictures, don`t let the size fool you
customer_reviews.text: I`m not a professional photographer but this camera takes some very good pictures, don`t let the size fool you. I recently took this camera on a trip to Italy and took it everywhere I went without being bothered by the weight of the camera and got some awesome pictures on the trip, I would highly recommend getting this camera. You can also use old manual lenses from Minolta, Olympus, Nikon e.t.c. with the fairly inexpensive adapters available so you can have some excellent quality manual lenses for a fraction of the price. I love it and would recommend it to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian I.

customer_reviews.title: especially for sports where it easily takes ten shots in about a second and is ...
customer_reviews.text: I give the camera five stars, especially for sports where it easily takes ten shots in about a second and is just amazing. I give the included lenses three stars. The lenses are inexpensive and small and light, but softer than I would have hoped. It's not a bad starter kit, but If can afford it, get the camera by itself and get a fixed lens with a lower f-stop and an expensive zoom made for one of the other alpha cameras.
customer_reviews.author: AES

customer_reviews.title: Received a broken camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased used. But I was not expecting to receive a defective camera that wasn’t going to function! There’s clearly something stuck in the memory card slot. I will be returning it but am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: great camera,very flexible
customer_reviews.text: I have very very nice old Minolta lens that I was hoping to use, and now i can. the kit lens are fine, but aren't as sharp as the older lens's i have, but again, I didn't expect them too. the focus assist has actually been useful, and the programmable buttons have been even a better bonus, really happy with this camera. and the seller was fantastic in communication and response/ shipping time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Super camera for walking around
customer_reviews.text: Focusing with this camera is so good it makes my past cameras obsolete. It is so light and easy to handle I cannot say enough about how well it suits my travel itineraries . Along with my A7RIII I have a complete package of options. Could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: svcace

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera (Sold Used As New)
customer_reviews.text: The function and form of this camera more than make-up for the fact that I was sent a used camera. Upon opening the box I was immediately struck by the fact all the little bags that the various pieces were in had clearly been opened. When I inspected the camera there wasn't any protective film on the screen and there were a couple of large finger smudges on the display. When I fired the camera up it was not in the factory default settings. I shoulda known better and got this where i can inspect the product before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Viking With An Axe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera, I bought it to use for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, I bought it to use for a side shooter during events and for when i walk around to have fun. So far, it's been exactly what I have wanted. Pros: I can use any flash Exposure simulation right in the viewfinder so I can spend all my time looking at my subject and changing my exposure nearly instant upload to social networking and my phone (note 4) lightweight, small, looks like a point and shoot doesn't attract attention High quality shots! Easy menu, customizable buttons Cons: Not so great lens selection and pretty expensive
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Sony A6000 takes good pictures and easy to shoot RAW and JPEG.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Aug 2017: Difficult to use menu and no touch screen. This camera take good pictures and easy to shoot RAW and JPEG once you set it up. Size: Not too big and not tiny. You'll need a camera bag, or shoulder bag. Fast shutter. Decent low light quality in European cities at night especially in Rome and Paris with low light scene. 2019 Long term review: After had this camera for 2 years, used it and took stunning pictures of Pyramids in Giza plateau and the glass pyramids in the courtyard of the Louvre Museum in Paris. This old camera is hard to beat with good quality pictures and price.
customer_reviews.author: Beethoven

customer_reviews.title: Excellen picture quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: There are more features on this camera than I will ever need but this camera is excellent. Takes excellent pictures and the basic features are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera for the price. I was trying to decide between this and a standard digital SLR. As an amateur, I'm glad I went this camera. It is easy to use and has features that bring my photography to a higher level without being cumbersome. Also, I don't really have a goal of becoming more professional and I am not looking for a bridge camera to use as I try to master SLR photography. Thus, this is perfect for me. I use it mostly when I take trips and want to take really high quality pictures and video without making it a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera - great colors & clarity.
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner on photography & this camera was recommended from a friend which has been doing it for years, using the same camera. The shots were amazing & easy to learn/ adjust. I'm excited to continue learning towards more advanced shots.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie K

customer_reviews.title: No need to download apps to make more money SONY
customer_reviews.text: Beginner to the hobby , very happy with the pictures . Not happy on purchasing all these extra apps to do things the camera is capable of doing and should be included with purchase
customer_reviews.author: njoiram

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: This is my new everyday camera. I take it with me just about everywhere, which is so easy to do because it is super light, small, and relatively compact. I'm used to Nikon DSLRs, so for me this little guy is like a compact camera with a DSLR-level sensor in it. I'm very happy with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: L. A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Pictures are really good on a regular user standards. Love the sony powered lens system, and nfc photo transfer is awesome, no more need to get my laptop to transfer a picture. Setup and menu a bit tricky but no issues. Not too heavy qnd good size. Excellent choise of camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sigfredo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: I'm really happy with the camera - especially the small footprint
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the pictures taken with the standard kit lens is comparable to the first run of mirrorless Alpha cameras from Sony a35, a55). I'm really happy with the camera - especially the small footprint. ALSO, I am not going to lie and say the fact that it is cute is not a factor in my rating.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Best Mirrorless Camera Option
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Sony a6000. It is an amazing camera. I'm hopeful that a newer version will soon appear and I can have both. I carried one of these around Europe last year and came back with hundreds of very good images. Never pushed the limits with the previous one. I never tried the facial recognition and eye focus, for example. But I will now. My only complaint is that Sony chose not to include a 3.5 mm microphone jack. The only microphones input is through the multi-interface-shoe and it doesn't work well. But for still photography it is a great camera and the video itself is good.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Pittle

customer_reviews.title: but for photography it's much better than Nikon and Canon at same price
customer_reviews.text: It heats for the video, but for photography it's much better than Nikon and Canon at same price. 11 shots for second, so good. And I had a 12800 ISO bride's portrait in a double page at my album. Can you imagine that with a t5i?
customer_reviews.author: Edisom Kamphorst

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first camera I ever get. I am not professional photographer but it is way above my expectation. If you know each function of this camera, you will be able to take professional-like photos! It is light and battery can last for three days even though I always turn it on and shut it off during the whole day on my Cali trip. I lost my lense cap because I always put it away. Wish it can be connected to the camera base.
customer_reviews.author: SherBear

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera, love the video quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for sports photography/videography and though I haven’t been able to record any sports lately... I have been putting it to the test in the real world. Great and easy camera to use, definitely recommend checking out some YouTube videos on what the best settings are for you and your style. Again, this is a camera that is easy to use and a great starter camera (this is my first mirrorless cam/slr and I’m loving it)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was pleasantly surprised and now after 2 weeks of use love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: Its super fast, takes great photos, its easy to carry and use. Its basically becoming my new walkabout camera for any occasion. Definitely a good buy for the deep discounted price I paid. I am not sure if I would love it if I had paid full retail price cause there is strong competition.
customer_reviews.author: Izak K.

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this camera from an older model, so I was able to use my lenses I already had. I absolutely LOVE this camera! If you had a Sony Alpha before- this one will not disappoint. It has the option to transfer photos to your computer or an app on your phone using wireless connection- which has saved me when I ran out of space on my memory card during a vacation. It takes beautiful photos and videos. I also like the new button they added to quickly switch to video or to rotate through the different modes without having to play with the digital screen.
customer_reviews.author: KSanch

customer_reviews.title: Great ILC
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just the right size and takes wonderful pictures. I currently am using my old Canon F1 lenses via adapters with great success. I only wish the Sony lenses were more reasonably priced as most of them are the cost of the camera and more. My favorite lens is the 35-105 Canon FD zoom, which with the adapter, makes it a well balanced piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: OldnGray

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm not as impressed with this camera as most. It is super fast but the auto focus is difficult to pin down. Trying to use aperture mode is difficult because the shutter speed goes to low for hand held. Some of my issues I'm sure are me not being familiar enough with it. It's definitely capable of great shots. For now I'll be sticking with my dslr
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would like to see Sony come out with more E mount ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible camera. Focus is extremely fast. Tremendous clarity. I know it will happen; but, I would like to see Sony come out with more E mount long telephotos. I also have a Nikon D7100 and resort to that camera for extreme telephoto. C'mon Sony, between the A6000 and the A6300, gotta have more long telephotos Not really interested in adapters to get what I want. Camera itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: phil b

customer_reviews.title: Could not manage it
customer_reviews.text: Tried it for a week or so... but in the end returned... the wifi feature is a pain in the neck to use... not user friendly at all. Plus I did not think that the pictures were that great. My older Canon took far better pics... what can I say? Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Bambs

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't turn on, instructions manual in French
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened here, but the instructions manual provided is in French (I looked for others, that was the only one provided). Ended up finding the manual online. Next, plugged in the required pieces to charge, and it didn't turn on. Not even a little bit. Components also seem quite cheap. All in all, pretty poor product.
customer_reviews.author: remo

customer_reviews.title: Great camera that you won't mind bringing with you wherever you go.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. I've taken it to Hawaii and Kyoto Japan and come back with some amazing pictures. Leaps and bounds beyond a point and shoot yet nice and lightweight due to the mirrorless design. I don't mind carrying this all day when I'm on trips which is nice. People like the more vintage look and I'm getting some great shots with it. I also like the feature that lets me send a photo to my phone wirelessly so that I can post to social media sights. Thanks Sony for making an approachable camera that gives high quality results.
customer_reviews.author: chortles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video performance
customer_reviews.text: For $600 you get: 24 megapixels of Sony APS-C sensor goodness. Fast focus. Crazy-fast shooting even with RAW+JPG. Electronic viewfinder. Excellent video performance. Excellent ergonomics. Wifi connectivity. That's a huge upgrade from the NEX-5 and it fixes the biggest deficiencies of the NEX-5. The only thing you give up is the extreme small size of the NEX-5 body, and the magnesium material use in the NEX-5. This is more classic Leica sized, and there's subtle nod to a retro aesthetic without going faux rangefinder. The design is all business. Unbeatable performance and value.
customer_reviews.author: Zigurd Mednieks

customer_reviews.title: Nikon and Canon make amazing products.
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I couldn't find any reason not to purchase it. Very versatile, lightweight, and image quality is stellar! Nikon and Canon make amazing products....but I found that the specs on the A6000 to be the absolute best offering under $1000. With 11.5FPS, APS-C sesnor, focus peaking, and live view - it really makes honing your craft a breeze and produces professional quality images when paired with the right lenses. I can't speak highly enough of this camera, and have turned more people on to photography because of it. Great job Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Joel G

customer_reviews.title: As good as they say
customer_reviews.text: The a6000 is an incredible camera. I went from the a5100 to the a6300 and when ny a6300 broke I bought this to replace it. My work requires the 4k ability and audio input of the a6300 unfortunately so i will be buying another one, but this a6000 served very well and I will certainly buy another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Super Newg Says

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner and never had a camera before this one. I bought used and it was worth it. The quality was like-new. I couldn't tell it was ever used before except that it was initially set in Japanese haha. I had to watch a few youtube videos to get it in English. I love the camera overall!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for the video
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a canon. Exaggerates color a bit, more vibrant than reality but overall good. I would say the canon took better pictures and had smarter auto focusing (not just the closest thing! I have to go into manual focus for photos all the time with the sony) The Sony blows the canon away in video though! Great smoother focusing in video, decent audio too. I take most pics with my phone these days so a true HD video function is mainly what I need and this fit the bill
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: The Sony A6000 meets my needs for street photography 100%!
customer_reviews.text: The Sony camera arrived earlier than expected and it excellent condition. Well packed. The camera performance is great! I don't see the need to get the more expensive model a6300. Spend your money on excellent glass like the Zeiss 28mm. Beautiful performing lens for street photography.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Marquina

customer_reviews.title: worth each penny I paid for the Sony a6000
customer_reviews.text: I am truly impressed. The highest of Sony quality, the functionality and ease / simplicity of taking second to none images. And all this condensed into the most handy mirror less camera. As a long time owner of a Canon rebel camera I have to admit that this Sony is above my expectations. It already became my primary one to use. Now all I have to do is to buy the appropriate arsenal of lenses for this camera. That might be a little downside if you don't have the extra funds available. Other than that the camera is worth each penny I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Ewe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera - lightweight, super fast frames per second, excellent in low lighting. Get your hands on a few old prime, manual focus lenses and you'll really learn how to use the A6000's many features fast. The birds were a surprise shot i wasn't set up for, but still . . . pretty cool. Love this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: LizLea

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Durable, lightweight, Superb Quality Mirrorless Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best camera I've ever owned. I switched from DSLR to Mirrorless and never looked back! After 3 different Canon camera upgrades and dissapointments, I had enough and switched to this. Best decision ever! Sony continues to impress with these kinds of new technologies, and mirrorless cameras is something they have mastered! Can't say enough about my Sony A600, other than I love the Superb quality, functions and lightweightness. This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Alen Barsin

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. I bought it used for about $300 and it came in perfect condition, with no scratches as described by the Seller. The camera is very comfortable in my hands and lightweight - great for traveling and backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: light, super portable and great image quality!
customer_reviews.text: Light and super portable! Image quality is greater than expected thanks to the 24 million pixels Sony puts on the APS-C size sensor, so that you can get great image quality even at high ISO (>3200). As for the fast auto focusing I haven't experienced it yet because I only used my two manual focus lenses on it. Up to now I am not bothered by any red shift problem for the A6000 using the two rangefinder lenses (Voigtlander Nokton 35/1.4 and Zeiss ZM 25/2.8). On the whole, I am pretty happy with this little guy on some street photography and casual occasions. If you get it at the promoted price $448, it's totally way over-worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Shen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have only one thing to say YOU BETTA WORK. I really love this camera. This is my first digital camera that I purchase. After researching and asking people about cameras, I am very glad that I purchased this Sony a6000. It’s been almost two years now, and the camera is perfect for my blog. The only negative that I have to say about this camera is that sometimes it doesn’t read my memory card. It will say unable to display.
customer_reviews.author: Stylealdrin

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner camera!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been wanting a camera for months. I finally decided to pull the trigger on this camera last month, and I'm so glad I did. I was looking for something lightweight and not too bulky that I can bring anywhere. This exceeds my expectations. Picture quality is great, the kit lenses are decent for beginners. But I am already wanting new exciting lenses. Overall I would recommend this little guy to anyone wanting to learn photography
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes get it
customer_reviews.text: So far I just love this little sucker. Coming from a Nikon d7000 I feel like I'm holding a phone. The size is why I got it. I'm just a hobbyist looking for a good image. This camera fits that. The focus speed on it is just amazing. I can walk along and stop for an brief moment and get a image that's focus is perfect. I recommend this camera to anyone and even more so for those people who love the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell keen

customer_reviews.title: Camera is good but Be carefull if you bought fm amazon warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I gave tree stars for material because I did not find in the package the AC adaptor as well as the body cap. Perhaps because I bought through Amazon Warehouse but it was not highlighted at all in the description
customer_reviews.author: Gabian

customer_reviews.title: Broke 6 days after 1 year warranty...buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Great camera...until 6 days after the 1 year warranty and noone will help. SIX DAYS. If you want it, suggest you waste money on the 3 yr because this one is not going to last!! Nothing like giving a gift to someone and having it break when you know they treasured it and took good care of it. I have no words for having let down an upcoming photographer/ young fellow trying to do something special. SIX DAYS after the one year...nope, buy a different one or buy it somewhere that understands service.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: So glad i switched to Mirrorless
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about switching from a dslr but once I did I am glad.Believe it or not there was a learning curving going to mirrorless. But the size and weight is a big difference from my Nikon D5000. Only thing I do not love is the sttap and will probably switch to a new lense. Lastlythe eye piece is sensitive if your finger is by it thwn it will turn of the lcd screen thinking your using the eye piece.
customer_reviews.author: sail4life

customer_reviews.title: Best mirrorless for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best camera for the money. The wife loves it and has been asked by family to take pictures
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett T. Cullens

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended — great device!
customer_reviews.text: What a great camera! We performed the firmware update (very important, folks — don't forget to do this!) and this camera got a whole lot better still! Autofocus is great. We're going to get a couple of additional lenses (the Sony 55-210 and a macro lens) to expand this puppy a little, but the stock lens is perfectly acceptable for a range of different scenarios — particularly if you use the auto lens correction in Lightroom. Highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: J. Loganbill

customer_reviews.title: E-mount lens- if you aren’t upgrading lenses it’s fine
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is fine. Supplemental lenses are hard to find because of the EMount that is not very common with more affordable but well made brands. This itself is a big disappointment because the 200mm lens just isn’t quite what I need.
customer_reviews.author: KatieRose

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too loud
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't get much time to use this camera as I am returning it. The reason...the shutter noise is *very* loud and there's no real way to silence it. I photograph live performances in theaters and the volume of this camera is not acceptable in single shot or burst mode. If volume is not an issue for you, please still consider this camera.
customer_reviews.author: D. Paukstys

customer_reviews.title: Light easy to carry, but high quality photos.
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures, like having both viewfinder and screen display option. Easy to use automatically or can dive into partial or full manual operation. Seems to work well in low light. Still learning how to use camera though. Deep menu that I need to understand better.
customer_reviews.author: Be Cool

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera for a hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: I don't think there's a better APS-C mirrorless camera, or even a DSLR, out there - and certainly not at this price. I've found the controls to be intuitive and highly customizable. The autofocus is as fast as you'll find in a mirrorless ILC and the autofocus lock-on has been a dream come true for me as I shoot fast moving working dogs. My only real complaint is that the pop-up flash cannot wirelessly trigger an external flash. You'll need to shell out $300 or more for one of Sony's flash units. Or, alternatively, you could buy radio controllers. Regardless, it's an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast camera for passionate photographers
customer_reviews.text: A great upgrade for my awesome Nikon D90 DSLR. It is also everything Sony A5000 wasn't: lighting fast shooting, fast focusing, good low light performance, good viewfinder, very portable. The only minuses I see are the battery (expected and quite normal for this type of camera) and very expensive E-mount lenses. For now I rely on the fast and clear E-mount Sigma 30mm prime that works perfectly w/ the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Minitechnicus

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality and features in a lightweight, small package.
customer_reviews.text: A college graduation gift for our daughter who will be backpacking in Europe next fall. She will be able to take exceptional photos and videos with a very small, light load. There is so much to love about this camera; she was especially tickled about the wifi to send pics directly to her phone. I doubt she will ever need another camera, nor will she ever run out of features to discover. Wish it had been for me...I lug around a full Canon kit!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fnatastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has exceeded my expectations. I have owned several SLR cameras before this and I cannot believe a camera so light and small can perform so well. There are a lot of features I have still not figured out how to use, but it is easy to experiment with and learn. The picture quality is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: JKT1

customer_reviews.title: The Amazing Sony a6000!!!
customer_reviews.text: Go Sony mirrorless and you will never go back to a DSLR! Get this camera and put the adventure back in your photography! I am amazed every time I try something new. The instruction manual sucks; but YouTube has all the instruction/tutorials you will need to figure out the multitude of camera setting available to you. Oh, by the way, the kit lens is very sharp--- as far as I am concerned. I came from a Canon 50D, and still can't believe the auto-focus and 11 fps shutter speed on the Sony a6000. Buy it and you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: So worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Just had it for two days and only took some pics from my bedroom window. The camera is amazing! Especially when shooting night scenes! The only thing I have to say is that it isn’t as smart when comes to transferring pics from the camera to iOS devices. A lot of wifi connection and disconnects. Also kinda wish it’s a touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Zhehang Li

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are chipped, can't use with grip, can't use generic batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Only complaint, easily fixed but still dislike is the fact Sony puts chips in their batteries. If you used two batteries in a grip (even if Sony) the chips don't agree with eachother and the camera shuts off saying improper battery installed. You can't use off market lithium batteries. If you're shooting a wedding or sports event you CANNOT miss a single second. Having your camera turn on and say "Screw you, I won't turn on" even though the battery is 80%, is beyond frustrating. Let me know if you found a loop hole or fix, so far, no one has.
customer_reviews.author: Devon W.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I took it to Iceland and Norway and it lived up to its expectation. Well built, great quality images at a bargain price. Great for my intension of using it for my personal blogging. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chun Xia

customer_reviews.title: good transaction, great product
customer_reviews.text: really perfect camera, light weight but strong...pictures speak for themselves, mirror-less cameras are just amazing. I have arthritis and had to give up my big Canon, it was just heavy to hold....I was very sad...then I bought this camera, picked some good lenses and decided to shoot the same scenery as I had before...so crisp, so vivid, amazing....I have since sold my other photography friends on this camera.
customer_reviews.author: B Moriath

customer_reviews.title: Sony a6000 Mirrorless Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am the proud owner of my first state of the art camera, the Sony a6000 crop sensor. It has all the features I can imagine an amateur and a professional would need. It takes great pictures and is so very user friendly.. I fully recommend it to anyone contemplating buying a camera.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: A very good beginner Sony mirrorless camera for the price of under ...
customer_reviews.text: A very good beginner Sony mirrorless camera for the price of under $500. It is very light weight and great to walk around with it. if you put long lens on it, then it may feel like unbalanced. Picture quality is good in reasonable low light. Again, this is more for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Sonal Shah

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a professional advertising photographer for 35 years and have owned every type of camera. This is my favorite all around camera. Very light weight and very responsive. The image quality is excellent. The price makes it one of the best deals in photography. I bought one for me and one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to operate. This is a great camera. Last week I went on a shoot with my Camera Club and there were four of us with the same Sony a6000 camera. Several of us had exchanged our heavier cameras for the a6000. I also ordered the QuickPro Camera Guide which helps with an indepth understanding of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Martin

customer_reviews.title: I love it, however
customer_reviews.text: I love it, however, IF you order this camera you need to know that Sony DOES NOT include a hotshoe cover for the spot where the external flash or attachments would go in the box for this. I have seen numerous complaints about this by others, but didn't see those complaints until after I received my camera and I immediately ordered one and paid for costly overnight shipping for it. If you order this camera make sure to order one when you place your order for the camera and save the expense on extra shipping. It's not a good idea to leave the shoe uncovered.
customer_reviews.author: shoremama

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine. I'm a sucker for new photo technology, and just upgraded from my NEX-5, which I purchased several years ago. This camera has nearly twice the megapixels, all the bells and whistles of its predecessor, and lots more stuff in the menus that I'm still exploring. The menu is a bit skimpy, but the in-camera help menu is just fine. It is a bit larger, however, and won't fit in the small leather fannypack I used for the NEX. But at least it doesn't look silly attached to my massive 18-200 Sony lens (which I also highly recommend).
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Buying is a great decision
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera. I wanted a step-up from my a55, and instead I got a new generation. It is a quick camera. I do a lot of "in motion" photography and its ability to maintain focus on high-speed shooting while he subject is moving is simply unsurpassed. One warning (minor). This does NOT come with a battery charger. There is a USB cord that plugs into the camera and that is it, so I recommend buying​ extra batteries and a separate charger.
customer_reviews.author: Gregjax Fl

customer_reviews.title: Some of the other cameras in this league would be more than that for just body and crappy kit lens
customer_reviews.text: This may not technically be the "best" mirrorless camera, but for the 450 i paid for the body, and the extra 600 i spent for the 35mm sony and 19mm sigma i am blown away. Some of the other cameras in this league would be more than that for just body and crappy kit lens. I know the e mount selection is limited, but unless you are a pro and need a lens for every possible scenario, i'd say who cares. Great camera, very glad i purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: dubious johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had heard a lot of hype about mirrorless and thought I would try this one and it was very easy to use but the image quality was minimal. It was not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Mikulski

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for a beginner. Enough customizability and manual controls that you can do pretty much anything you want, but enough idiot-proof presets to make it usable by someone like me who's relatively new to photography. The fact that it can use the whole line of E-mount lenses makes it very upgradable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Look for something better than this
customer_reviews.text: Not a great camera for the price. Blurry images often. Back screen doesn’t flip all the way around. No touch screen. Not user friendly, there are many other cameras with better options in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Diesha Condon

customer_reviews.title: A worthy upgrade from NEX 5
customer_reviews.text: Having had my NEX 5 N for 3 years, the a6000 is a definitely worthy upgrade. The body feels more sturdy and higher quality built. The build-in flash is usable, and can come in handy in quick shots. Since the camera has OSS, now all of the NEX5 lenses are actually stabilized. This is my favorite travel camera now. Compact and high quality, with semi professional settings including long exposure and easily adjustable P/S/A/M modes. Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Ming Paul Wang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Example of "Good Things Come in Small Packages"
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the trade-offs between cost, size, and performance, it might be impossible to beat this camera. You can accomplish most of what you can with a much larger DSLR in a very small package, and at a decent price. Image quality is great and there are a lot of lens options. When shooting in continuous mode, the maximum 11 FPS is really amazing even when compared to much more expensive cameras. Hauling around a DSLR isn't always the most attractive option and this camera is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: DarkWater13

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. It has features found on much more expensive cameras. I have owned camera for a year. The right side of the control wheel is getting weak and is wearing out. I am disappointed in the construction of this camera. My old NEX3N is several years old and is a better built camera. I don't think the warrantee on the camera is worth much. Great pictures on this camera.
customer_reviews.author: F Ben Kautz

customer_reviews.title: Best user-friendly camera without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera. Very compact and easy to travel with. Im a barber and I bought this to take photos of my haircuts, and I'm not experienced in DSLR use, but this is a very user-friendly camera. 5/5!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Young

customer_reviews.title: love this camera
customer_reviews.text: very good camera, it took me a while to master most of the functionality and still a lot to know. the focus is fast and it took impressive video clips with no noticeable out of focus at all. i love the in camera HDR results, and it quite fast indeed. picture quality is very good but i think it is not perfect, but good deal for the money. the only thing is that the camera body is small and the lenses available are large and quite nice appealing, i just close on eye on that issue. all in all i am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Morsi

customer_reviews.title: this is the most easy to use camera I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: After watching a few videos on youtube, this is the most easy to use camera I have ever had. The most liked feature is the live viewing mode. What you see in the viewfinder, is what you will get as the picture. Adjusting for different light exposures is so easy!!
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Alumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like the viewfinder as it was too small and blurry. I couldn’t figure out how to use the WiFi transfer to my phone when I looked at online reviews for the Sony app they were terrible so I returned it. The main reason I purchased it was to transfer photo to my phone as I won’t have laptop with me on our trip.
customer_reviews.author: WLL

customer_reviews.title: Great photos / fast camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fast and takes great pictures. The portrait shots are clear. The menu structure is a little complex but after watching a few online videos, I've managed to dial in the settings for my uses. If you Google Gary Fong he has a pretty thorough video (can fast forward to about 30 min mark) that will help a more novice photographer (like me) know how to setup the camera and what the setttings do.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack1999
